name: default left camera sensitivity parameters
_comment: If 'cov' is available it corresponds to the joint covariance matrix of extrinsic and intrinsic parameters.
'cov', if present, supersedes individual 'extrinsics' and 'intrinsics' parameters.
If 'cov' is available it corresponds to the joint covariance matrix of translation and rotation perturbations.
'cov', if present, supersedes individual 'translation' and 'rotation' parameters.
Translation std is in units of mm.
Rotation std is in units of mrad.
If 'cov' is available it corresponds to the joint covariance matrix of pinhole and distortion parameters.
'cov', if present, supersedes individual 'pinhole' and 'distortion' parameters.
Pinhole parameters are in units of pix.
Distortion parameters are adimensional, but some of them should be thought of as percentage of focal length.
If 'cov' is available it corresponds to the joint covariance matrix of all pinhole parameters.
'cov', if present, supersedes individual 'principal point' and 'focal length' parameters.
Std of pinhole parameters has units of pix.
The distortion model assumes Polynomial3K, with a two-dimensional distortion center and three distortion coefficients.
If 'cov' is available it corresponds to the joint covariance matrix of all distortion parameters.
'cov', if present, supersedes individual 'distortion center' and 'distortion coefficient' parameters.
Std of distortion center has units of % of focal length.
Std of distortion coefficients have units of %^-2, %^-4, and %^-6 of focal_length.
